questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to handle exceptions in Python?
questions.funFact: Python uses try and except blocks to catch and handle errors gracefully, instead of crashing the program.

questions.questionText: Which method is used to add an item to a list?
questions.funFact: The append() method adds an item to the end of a list — lists in Python can grow dynamically!

questions.questionText: Dictionaries in Python store data as key-value pairs?
questions.funFact: Python dictionaries are similar to real-world dictionaries — each key has one value linked to it.

questions.questionText: Which built-in function returns the absolute value of a number?
Which keyword is used to create a class in Python?
questions.funFact: Classes in Python let you group data and behavior into reusable blueprints — the heart of OOP!

questions.questionText: Which symbol is used for floor division?
Which module is used for working with JSON in Python?
questions.funFact: The json module lets Python read and write data in JSON format — perfect for APIs and web apps!

questions.questionText: Which function returns the data type of a variable?
Tuples in Python are mutable?
questions.funFact: Tuples are immutable — once created, their contents cannot be changed.

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to inherit from a parent class?
questions.funFact: Inheritance lets a class reuse code from another — a powerful feature of OOP in Python!

questions.questionText: Which method removes and returns the last list item?
Which keyword is used to define an anonymous function?
questions.funFact: Lambda functions are short one-line functions — useful for quick tasks like sorting or filtering.

questions.questionText: Which built-in function returns the largest value?
Which keyword is used to exit a loop early?
questions.funFact: The break statement immediately ends a loop — great for stopping when a condition is met!

questions.questionText: Sets in Python allow duplicate values?
Which function reads input from the user?
questions.funFact: The input() function reads user input as text — you can convert it later using int() or float().

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to start a module import?
Which operator is used for logical AND?
Which method can be used to sort a list in place?
questions.funFact: The sort() method changes the original list — while sorted() creates a new sorted copy.

questions.questionText: Which function creates a range of numbers?
Which function returns the smallest value in a list?
Which keyword is used to continue a loop?
A dictionary key must be unique?
Which function is used to get the ASCII value of a character?
Which function converts a character code to a string?
Which function returns the number of items in a list?
questions.funFact: len() can also be used on strings, tuples, and dictionaries — it’s one of Python’s most useful functions.

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to create a new module?
Which method is used to replace text in strings?
Python variables can change type at runtime?
questions.funFact: Python is dynamically typed — a variable can store a number, then a string later in the same program.

questions.questionText: Which operator is used for logical OR?
Which method adds elements from another list?
Which function checks memory address of a variable?
Python supports operator overloading?
questions.funFact: Operator overloading allows classes to define behavior for +, -, * and other operators!

questions.questionText: Which operator is used for membership testing?
Which method removes all items from a list?
Which built-in function returns a sorted list from an iterable?
Python supports multiple inheritance?
Which operator is used for identity comparison?
Which function returns the Unicode string representation of an object?
Which keyword is used to define a generator?
Sets in Python are unordered?
Which operator is used for exponentiation?
questions.funFact: The ** operator in Python means power — 2 ** 3 equals 8.

questions.questionText: Which module provides mathematical functions like sin and cos?
Which function returns all keys of a dictionary?
Which function converts a list of tuples into a dictionary?
Which keyword is used to handle exceptions?
Which function returns the ASCII code of a character?
Which keyword is used to define a class method?
Frozen sets in Python are immutable?
Which module is used to work with random numbers?
questions.funFact: The random module can generate random numbers, shuffle lists, or even pick random choices!
